name: ITP004C - Hot Mix Asphalt Production – Airfield Asphalt
template name: ITP004C - Hot Mix Asphalt Production – Airfield Asphalt

name: Frequency: Prior to each work shift

• The production plan shall demonstrate that the production capacity and the hot storage capacity of the mixing plant is sufficient to supply asphalt to complete the work undertaken within each shift.
• It will ensure that there will be no interruption to the placement of asphalt.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.4.15.1
1.2 - Checking of Weighting Devices and Certificates
Acceptance Criteria: The Contractor shall supply details of current certification of weighing equipment including belt weighers and weighbridges to the Contract Administrator.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.4.15.6
• Calibrating all necessary devices and parameters at the mixing plant to achieve the “Job Mix”.
• Established plants shall provide historical records of the asphalt production over the previous one (1) month to verify consistency.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.4.15.11
1.4 - Material Submission (Coarse and Fine Aggregates and Added Filler)
Acceptance Criteria: Submission of a report which contains:
• Details about the source of the material.
• Summary of recent test results indicating compliance with the specification requirements.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl
Frequency: Once per 200 tonnes of asphalt produced

• The temperature of the mix immediately following discharge from the mixer shall be within 10ºC of that nominated by the Contractor but shall not be greater than 175ºC (for polymer modified bitumen).
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.8.1
Acceptance Criteria: Not less than 2300 kg/m3

Frequency: Prior to commencing each production shift
• All samples of bitumen must be obtained in accordance with AS 2008.
• Samples of bitumen shall be taken during construction at the rate of one (1) sample from each separate delivery vessel delivered to the mixing plant.
• The samples shall consist of two (2) 0.5 litre (minimum) sealed containers labelled appropriately identifying the relevant lot and traceability to the source.
• These samples to be submitted to the Contract Administrator.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Frequency: Prior to commencing each production shift
Acceptance Criteria: Bitumen is to be tested at the point of delivery. The sample is to be tested for the following:
• Torsional recovery at 25°C, 30 s according to AG:PT/T122
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.5.3.2
Frequency: Once per 200t asphalt produced or 1 test per shift (whichever is greater)
Acceptance Criteria: Mix to be sampled from asphalt delivery trucks.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.10.2
Frequency: At the end of each production shift

Acceptance Criteria: The Contractor shall determine the average bitumen content of each size of asphalt produced during each continuous mixing period or shift based on the total quantity of bitumen used and total asphalt produced.
Reference Documents: AECOM – MAP MP Spec. Cl 12.4.15.7
Record of conformity: Records of bitumen usage
Frequency: Once per sample obtained as per Item 6.1 of this document
Acceptance Criteria: Moisture content of asphalt to be <0.5%.
